m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-noexcerpt”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2gUZfdV” title=”Help:IPA/English” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/English&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719767000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFPlyJQ8s51-aDODCJ-dYfGKni8Ng”>/<span style=”border-bottom:1px dotted”><span title=”/ˈ/: primary stress follows”>ˈ</span><span title=“‘k’ in ‘kind’”>k</span><span title=”/eɪ/: ‘a’ in ‘face’”>eɪ</span><span title=“‘l’ in ‘lie’”>l</span><span title=”/ə/: ‘a’ in ‘about’”>ə</span><span title=“‘b’ in ‘buy’”>b</span></span>/</a></span></span>&nbsp;is courtesy of the&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gVeHGB” title=”Great Vowel Shift” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Vowel_Shift&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719767000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHkFCT-AvPrQ8L2Z57L9aK-dp66kA”>Great Vowel Shift</a>.</span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>Caleb, son of&nbsp;<a class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-mw-redirect” href=”http://bit.ly/2gU6NgG” title=”Jephunneh” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jephunneh&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGpPl_ECDaDJkijorJuI1-_P8XOjw”>Jephunneh</a>&nbsp;(Numbers 13:6) is not to be confused with Caleb, great-grandson of&nbsp;<a class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-mw-redirect” href=”http://bit.ly/2gV28eL” title=”Judah (biblical person)” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judah_(biblical_person)&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHF7TUM8mnuydXIZYa-DUFJIsVQ-A”>Judah</a>&nbsp;through&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xollMW” title=”Tamar (Genesis)” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamar_(Genesis)&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGVHct0fSC3MUXjBpSjTPfbfTJf_g”>Tamar</a>&nbsp;(1 Chronicles 2:3-9). This other Caleb was the&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gUghJ2” title=”Caleb (son of Hezron)” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb_(son_of_Hezron)&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGlyupxq8Jhm9ROJWJpCG0DLOE0Qg”>son of Hezron</a>, and his wife was Azubah (I Chronicles 2:18,19).</span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>According to Numbers 13, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, was one of&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xnENcx” title=”The Twelve Spies” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Twelve_Spies&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNE9h5Oo9X6ooJ9BZ_Ep_jHs52JoIw”>the twelve spies</a>&nbsp;sent by&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gTI2Bm” title=”Moses” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moses&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNF7AUdAMRn8fbhvFEHYq0ZGus_9oA”>Moses</a>&nbsp;into Canaan. Their task, over a period of 40 days,<span class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-reference” id=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-cite_ref-3” style=”font-size:6.75px;line-height:1;vertical-align:baseline;unicode-bidi:isolate;white-space:nowrap”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xn1zBa” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb%23cite_note-3&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHCeyxNVIRD5a01yS2JXbIL4XZwWA”>[3]</a></span>&nbsp;was to explore the&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xnwHk7” title=”Negev” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negev&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHLD9hhGiYf6_xRP7nVP0E-0oT6yw”>Negev</a>&nbsp;and surrounding area, and to make an assessment of the geographical features of the land, the strength and numbers of the&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gTy9DW” title=”Population” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Population&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNECVypjNDh2ieh1ZQ86LXkCo2zbLA”>population</a>, the&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gUwJsG” title=”Agriculture” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agriculture&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGOtOqBb3RpVjq-g3Qg_uOfzbA_0w”>agricultural</a>&nbsp;potential and actual performance of the land, settlement patterns (whether their&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xnY7Gu” title=”City” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/City&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGSY06v7vmh7fAEvd2nRBaW9yMkFA”>cities</a>&nbsp;were like camps or strongholds), and&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xoNFyq” title=”Forestry” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forestry&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFqCu80BCvALT_9KfgNGJiFnmFamA”>forestry</a>&nbsp;conditions. Moses also asked them to be courageous and to return with samples of local produce.<span class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-reference” id=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-cite_ref-4” style=”font-size:6.75px;line-height:1;vertical-align:baseline;unicode-bidi:isolate;white-space:nowrap”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xoNGlY” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb%23cite_note-4&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHJ-eJ1PaTX6KnqOuxcb_DQKwxBPg”>[4]</a></span></span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>In the Numbers 13 listing of the heads of each tribe, verse 6 reads “Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.” Caleb’s report balanced the appeal of the land and its fruits with the challenge of making a conquest.</span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>Verse 30 of chapter 13 reads “And Caleb stilled the people toward Moses, and said: ‘We should go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it.’”<span class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-reference” id=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-cite_ref-5” style=”font-size:6.75px;line-height:1;vertical-align:baseline;unicode-bidi:isolate;white-space:nowrap”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xoNHX4” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb%23cite_note-5&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFOu5XSVqwEHaNHhoD7KB5XUvDjtg”>[5]</a></span>&nbsp;Caleb and&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gV2fqH” title=”Joshua” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joshua&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNG0TVw7xUGu7dCA9tVeub-alknTlw”>Joshua</a>&nbsp;said the people should trust God and go into the land; the other ten spies, being fearful and rebellious, argued that conquering the land was impossible.</span></div><div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>Caleb the spy is the son of Jephunneh. Jephunneh is called a&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gTEEq0” title=”Kenizzite” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenizzite&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFdXQDc57cgm-tGnR2ChffgBR6i9g”>Kenizzite</a>&nbsp;(Numbers 32:12, Joshua 14:6,14). The Kenizzites are listed (Genesis 15:19) as one of the nations who lived in the land of Canaan, at the time that God covenanted with Abram (Abraham) to give that land to his descendants forever (Genesis 17:8). However, Caleb is mentioned alongside the descendants of Judah recorded in 1 Chronicles 4: “And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the sons of Elah: Kenaz” (1 Chronicles 4:15).<span class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-reference” id=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-cite_ref-6” style=”font-size:6.75px;line-height:1;vertical-align:baseline;unicode-bidi:isolate;white-space:nowrap”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2gUnFnC” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb%23cite_note-6&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFmcHmh1uyfaM96G5Sn0sI32IuJzg”>[6]</a></span>&nbsp;Numbers 13:6, likewise, lists Caleb as a tribal leader in Judah.</span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>The Kenizzites are generally considered an Edomite clan (see Genesis 36:40-43).<span class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-reference” id=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-cite_ref-FreedmanMyers2000_7-0” style=”font-size:6.75px;line-height:1;vertical-align:baseline;unicode-bidi:isolate;white-space:nowrap”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xnXYDb” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb%23cite_note-FreedmanMyers2000-7&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHFsadWIp2rMba0uutbMCGrJwWnwg”>[7]</a></span></span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”><b>Kaleb</b>&nbsp;(c. 520) is perhaps the best-documented, if not best-known, King of&nbsp;<a class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-mw-redirect” href=”http://bit.ly/2gTU2D1” title=”Kingdom of Axum” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_of_Axum&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGDGsuHWLikQhg1eL8Nt_cbATpbXg”>Axum</a>&nbsp;situated in modern-day&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xoYLUd” title=”Eritrea” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eritrea&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGD_v3Rx622ISH4weP0krkESlcBRA”>Eritrea</a>&nbsp;and North&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gTgJXZ” title=”Ethiopia” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethiopia&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGOxYtZJxh08XdcsqL76l1QmY2ppg”>Ethiopia</a>.</span></div><div style=”line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”><a class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-mw-redirect” href=”http://bit.ly/2gTE4sC” title=”Procopius of Caesarea” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none;font-family:sans-serif” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procopius_of_Caesarea&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFb2Z2AEdQLyS0VxVe66ZlQb3eRXA”>Procopius of Caesarea</a><span style=”font-family:sans-serif”>&nbsp;calls him “</span><span style=’font-family:”arial black”,sans-serif’>Hellestheaeus</span><span style=”font-family:sans-serif”>”, a variant of his throne name&nbsp;</span><b style=”font-family:sans-serif”>Ella Atsbeha</b><span style=”font-family:sans-serif”>&nbsp;or&nbsp;</span><b style=”font-family:sans-serif”>Ella Asbeha</b><span style=”font-family:sans-serif”>&nbsp;(</span><i style=”font-family:sans-serif”>Histories</i><span style=”font-family:sans-serif”>, 1.20). Variants of his name are Hellesthaeus, Ellestheaeus, Eleshaah, Ella Atsbeha, Ellesboas, and Elesboam, all from the Greek Ελεσβόάς, for “The one who brought about the morning” or “The one who collected tribute.”</span></span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>At Aksum, in inscription RIE 191, his name is rendered in unvocalized Gə’əz as KLB ‘L ‘ṢBḤ WLD TZN (Kaleb ʾElla ʾAṣbeḥa son of Tazena). In vocalized Gə’əz, it is ካሌብ እለ አጽብሐ (Kaleb ʾƎllä ʾAṣbəḥa).</span></div><div style=”font-family:sans-serif;line-height:inherit;margin:0.5em 0px”><span style=”font-size:xx-small”>Kaleb, a name derived from the Biblical character&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gTE5ga” title=”Caleb” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caleb&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNF6S2CbnwtMdPXDhf31-P87M56C6w”>Caleb</a>, is his given biblical name; ʾOn both his coins and inscriptions he left at&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2gUZ7eg” title=”Axum” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axum&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHb6-TgnrUUoE0vg4C85VHlOEjN-Q”>Axum</a>, as well as Ethiopian hagiographical sources and king lists, he refers to himself as the son of Tazena.<span class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-reference” id=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-cite_ref-7” style=”font-size:6.75px;line-height:1;vertical-align:baseline;unicode-bidi:isolate;white-space:nowrap”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xoAJbR” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaleb_of_Axum%23cite_note-7&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNF_Q4REjUdCAWBGaNPxM9UEuHTRqA”>[6]</a></span>&nbsp;He may be the “Atsbeha” or “Asbeha” of the Ethiopian legends of&nbsp;<a class=”m_-2406931458228765498m_7062753601417727326gmail-m_258112447631369337m_2341308960067590409m_4521999671932699583gmail-new” href=”http://bit.ly/2gW0adO” title=”Abreha and Asbeha (page does not exist)” style=”background:none;color:rgb(165,88,88);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title%3DAbreha_and_Asbeha%26action%3Dedit%26redlink%3D1&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNHOPMN8kfHG1WHG0CrjXAci9hK1WQ”>Abreha and Asbeha</a>, the other possibility being&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xpit2k” title=”Ezana of Axum” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ezana_of_Axum&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNH8tVye3bHX7nk_9tXlsDUG34H9vw”>Ezana’s</a>&nbsp;brother&nbsp;<a href=”http://bit.ly/2xp4IAw” title=”Saizana” style=”background:none;color:rgb(11,0,128);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saizana&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGiT7h4ZaTVqHTj3tWcIJFMwMyLsg”>Saizana</a>.</span></div></div></div></center></div></div> </center></div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div></center></div><div style=”color:rgb(41,41,41);font-family:Lora,serif;font-size:20px;text-align:center”><br /></div><div style=”color:rgb(41,41,41);font-family:Lora,serif;font-size:20px;text-align:center”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xoENZC” style=”background:transparent;color:rgb(37,161,134);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://threetag.reallyhim.com&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNGbEzII34xSf9TZmMoEdsOjBTuWAg”><img alt=”” border=”0” src=”irmax_files/image-798888.png” style=”border:0px;margin-right:0px” width=”355” height=”66” /></a></div><div style=”color:rgb(41,41,41);font-family:Lora,serif;font-size:20px;text-align:center”><a href=”http://bit.ly/2xp4Sb6” style=”background:transparent;color:rgb(37,161,134);text-decoration-line:none” target=”_blank” data-saferedirecturl=”http://www.google.com/url?hl=en&amp;q=http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c%3D1385658%26l%3D63749c8f-a0bf-4707-9c51-db57eb816681%26r%3D969fb711-72fb-4550-bf08-015dcddf657a&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1505066719768000&amp;usg=AFQjCNFzbLzvx0_-rJ-9UwZuGdKaNFw8wQ”><img
